option.name: originalContent
option.value:
spring.application.name=patient-service
# Use embedded H2 for quick local development (uncomment if you want an in-memory DB) # spring.datasource.url=jdbc:h2:mem:patientdb;DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1;DB_CLOSE_ON_EXIT=FALSE # spring.datasource.driver-class-name=org.h2.Driver # spring.jpa.database-platform=org.hibernate.dialect.H2Dialect # spring.h2.console.enabled=true # spring.h2.console.path=/h2-console
# PostgreSQL datasource (example for a Docker container named `patient-service-db`) # IMPORTANT: the JDBC URL must include the // after the protocol (jdbc:postgresql://host:port/db) spring.datasource.url=jdbc:postgresql://patient-service-db:5432/db spring.datasource.driver-class-name=org.postgresql.Driver
# JPA / Hibernate behaviour spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update
# Control execution of SQL init scripts (data.sql). Set to 'always' to run against external DBs.
server.port=4000
logging.level.root=info

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
spring.application.name=patient-service
# Use embedded H2 for quick local development (uncomment if you want an in-memory DB) # spring.datasource.url=jdbc:h2:mem:patientdb;DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1;DB_CLOSE_ON_EXIT=FALSE # spring.datasource.driver-class-name=org.h2.Driver # spring.jpa.database-platform=org.hibernate.dialect.H2Dialect # spring.h2.console.enabled=true # spring.h2.console.path=/h2-console
# PostgreSQL datasource (example for a Docker container named `patient-service-db`) # IMPORTANT: the JDBC URL must include the // after the protocol (jdbc:postgresql://host:port/db) spring.datasource.url=jdbc:postgresql://patient-service-db:5432/db spring.datasource.username=postgres spring.datasource.password=postgres spring.datasource.driver-class-name=org.postgresql.Driver
# JPA / Hibernate behaviour spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update # If you want data.sql to run AFTER Hibernate creates the tables (safest for INSERTs), uncomment: spring.jpa.defer-datasource-initialization=true
# Control execution of SQL init scripts (data.sql). Set to 'always' to run against external DBs. spring.sql.init.mode=always
server.port=4000
logging.level.root=info
